p:
The Walter Reed Army Institute of Research has developed a whole-virus, formalin-inactivated vaccine.
62 This vaccine has been tested with and without alum, utilizing multiple immunization routes, and in both mice and nonhuman primates. Vaccination elicits high-titer neutralizing antibodies as well as cellular immune responses and produces sterile immunity in rhesus macaques.
73 This vaccine has undergone phase 1 clinical trials (ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT02937233, NCT02952833, NCT02963909), and another phase 1, dose de-escalation study examining safety and immunogenicity is ongoing ( NCT03008122). The results from the first 3 trials indicate that recipients developed robust neutralizing antibody titers that on transfer into miceÂ significantly reduced or eliminated viral titers following ZIKV challenge.
74 Adverse effects were reported by 84% of recipients but were relatively minor (eg, pain or tenderness at injection site, fatigue, headache, malaise).
